Extra info: asalisa refers to stars in general. Sol, the particular star that Earth revolves around, is called "Solisa"

Thiguka: moon (Luna; the specific moon that revolves around Earth)
to live; to be alive (v) / life (n)

(n) work / labor / effort
(v) to work, to put in effort
desire; to desire or want something
decision (as in "my decision to do this")

Extra info: (with fah- agent noun prefix), also, "pelifefi" (from "lahgupeli lahfefi", lit. "dance person")
This word exists because Lemuria was wondering what a "saralang" was for the "Hiidaden" thread in the Conlangs Discord Network, and he didn't realize the creator's name was Sara.

Thiguka:
storm (lit. large wind)

also: hurricane, typhoon, cyclone
comply; abide (by a law); follow (the rules)

(verb) break (a law, rule); to not comply;
(noun) violation (of a law)

Extra info:
shortening of "pelupahsa kufasa pelutayelah kolagasa thaguithere tharasagtayelah"

pelu-pah-sa kufa-sa pelu-tay-elah kolaga-sa tha~gu-ithere tharasag-tay-elah
person-NOM-SG compel-PRS person-ACC-PL comply-PRS AGR~ADJ-internet rule-ACC-PL
Tags/parts of speech: person who makes people follow internet rules

Extra info: Thiguka's phonotactics allow saying Tagalog without modifications, so it is the exact same.

Because ['ɹusia] sounds too far from the English pronunciation and 
Thiguka has no [ʌ], Thiguka instead borrows from the native Russian 
pronunciation [rɐˈsʲijə].
Because Thiguka words may not end in -r, -l, or -k, a dummy -a is added.

Thiguka: daytime (when the sun is in the sky)
very important person; VIP (Thiguka native translation)

Extra info: Thiguka negative number suffix (zero of something)
Thiguka first person plural inclusive pronoun (speaker and listener)

Extra info: Thiguka first person plural exclusive pronoun (speaker and speaker's friends, but not listener)
